Understate: The claim may understate the impact of the changes to early voting by focusing on the number of hours available for voting instead of the overall reduction in the number of days.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that longer hours on fewer days will provide the same level of accessibility and convenience for voters, which may be a problematic assumption.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough supporting evidence or data to prove that the changes to early voting will actually result in more people being able to take advantage of early voting.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the changes to early voting, such as potential voter suppression efforts, as suggested by Democrats.
